Passage: Greetings to the abundant month of May, bringing joy, youth, and warm desires! The woods and fields adorned by your touch, hills and valleys rejoice in your blessings. We sing to welcome you, wishing you a long stay. My heart belongs to the Highlands, chasing deer and following the roe. Farewell to the Highlands, the land of valor and worth, forever cherished. The mountains capped with snow bid adieu, the green valleys and forests below, the rushing waters and roaring floods. My heart remains in the Highlands, no matter where I go. Witness the lone Highland lass in the field, reaping and singing a melancholy tune. Her song, a melody that lingers long after it fades. The beauty of the morning, a sight so majestic, a city draped in silence and splendor. The river flows freely, the houses seem asleep, a calm so profound. Soldier, rest now, your battles over, dream peacefully in our enchanted hall. No more sounds of war, just the lark's fife at daybreak and the bittern's drum. Rest, huntsman, your chase complete, sleep under our slumb'rous spells, no bugles to disturb your dreams.

Passage: He turned around, ignoring the cowardly ranks, not speaking to Lars Porsena or Sextus. His bravery in battle was unmatched, his heart pure. He fought to save others from shame and thrall, untouched by love's kiss, his heart dedicated to faith and prayer.
